overview: This documentary, filmed over a 10-year period, centers on the debate over censorship as it follows Vancouver's Little Sister's Bookstore and its 20-year struggle with Canada Customs over the seizure of books. In the face of bigotry, bombings and repeated book seizures, it wages the most important legal battle in history against Canada Customs.

production_companies.name: Canadian Film or Video Production Tax Credit (CPTC)

title: Little Sister's vs. Big Brother
